page.title: 06HOUSING IN KILWINNING
page.content: When Kilwinning became part of Irvine New Town more people came to live in the area.In 1966 the population was eight thousand and is sixteen thousand seven hundred and twenty today.IRVINE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION built its first housing scheme of one thousand two hundred and fifteen houses to be rented or sold at PENNYBURN.Their policy was to build houses within a walking distance from a primary school and to provide houses in pleasing surroundings.Many of the houses are in squares and in cul-de sacs without the danger of through traffic. They also provided sheltered housing for old people near the shops. Private houses in considerable variety were built by a number of builders at Whitehirst Park, Northacre and Park Lane.Kilwinning has private houses,council houses and IDC houses.
